simulating the behavior of the Next Generation probe head for a particular type of NMR machine uh this particular
user had a decent cluster in-house but the cluster was 80% used doing uh doing sort of day-to-day engineering uh it was

behind a VPC for security and resource isolation and access control um we had two separate subnets one subnet is for

the science stuff and this worked this was wonderful I stood this up in a couple of hours it was a really big deal

example um if you've ever dealt with flexem licensing you'll know that your license codes are deeply tied to the MAC address of your network card if your
network card changes if your Mac address changes your license breaks your software comes screeching to a halt if
you're lucky you might get a new license cut in a couple of hours more realistically it's a couple of days um that's kind of a pain in the butt on the
cloud with virtual servers and things that go up and down your Mac addresses uh you know they they tend to change so um Amazon has this wonderful thing
elastic network interface you can separate the MAC address from the network and you can map Macs and Mac as long as you're within a VPC you've got
this um tiny tiny little feature that doesn't exist in someone else's Cloud but it instantly and permanently solved
my commercial software licensing problem on Amazon in a way that would be a little bit painful to do on someone else's platform so it's just one example
